content:
Downvoted :(

* Goal section should not mention RETURN, but OUTPUT since the stub code is IO based and not in a function

* The input section should be :

  Given a list of [[X]] integers, with each integer denoted as [[N]]

* Following should be moved to Output section && it should be

   > Average rounded up to the nearest integer

* [[X]] is a variable , not a constant {{X}}

* Missing test cases when [[X]] is 2 && 3

* Duplicate of https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/327e830c23a0a2529fa641f89c60f319763 (Median)

&&  https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/5548a74068cee159db7ca45a8ffe7b7c97b (Average)

"Average rounded upwards to the next integer."

There are no tests designed to test this specific rounding requirement vs. regular rounding / rounding down.
Agree with @miracle, for the reverse enginnering mode.

The task is too difficult for the reverse engineering mode IMO. The use of average and median functions already takes quite some effort (for average players) to try out since one needs to code to calculate them for the test cases. Throwing the length of input list into the mix makes it even more complicated and hard to guess. If the target function is not obvious, the reverse engineering task needs to provide enough hints (through test cases) to guide the search of the function and a small set of tests for other modes usually do not suffice.
You're right, i change the first test case
